result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D Banks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael D Banks not in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Michael D Banks.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Statements by defense counsel that defendant has pending case 22CF2890 in Branch 19. Court will allow this case to be transferred to Branch 19 for global resolution if Judge Ashley is willing to accept jurisdiction. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael D Banks not in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Michael D Banks.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference. State is in compliance with victim notification.
Defense counsel informed the Court this case status is pending the Branch 19 case which has been adjourned to 10/18/2022.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael D Banks not in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Michael D Banks.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. 
Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending case in Branch 19. Court will allow this case to be transferred to Branch 19 if Judge Ashley is willing to accept jurisdiction. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Michael D Banks not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Hearing held via Zoom.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. 
Defense counsel informed the Court that defendant has a pending felony matter (22CF2890) scheduled for a preliminary hearing on 9/9/2022.
Case adjourned to Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Adriana M-S., Armani V.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
 Defendant Michael D Banks in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Michael D Banks in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.
  Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
